definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: Ji maintained that "Cultural exchange is the main drive for humankind`s progress.
sentences.chinese: 季羡林认为，“文化交流是人类进步的主要动力之一。

sentences.english: Cultural interflow and culture came into being synchronically.
sentences.chinese: 文化交流与文化同时产生。

sentences.english: The cultural exchanges between China and Norway, started in 1963, have benefited the peoples of our two countries in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，积极活跃的文化交流已使两国人们受益。

sentences.english: To promote students' global perspective and cultural interaction.
sentences.chinese: 促进学生国际观与文化交流。

sentences.english: The third scientific technological revolution has shortened the spatiotemporal distance and accelerated the cultural exchanges.
sentences.chinese: 新科技革命缩小了时空距离，加速了文化交流。

sentences.english: We all know that English has become the language of international trade and culture interflow .
sentences.chinese: 众所周知，英语已经成为国际贸易和文化交流的语言。

sentences.english: Supplemental to services provided are many OU Confucius sponsored events that celebrate Chinese culture and cultural exchange.
sentences.chinese: 俄大孔子学院还资助了很多文化交流和中文文化活动。

sentences.english: The pattern of the washer that modeled on Arabic metal implements is product of Chinese and western cultural exchange.
sentences.chinese: 型仿阿拉伯金属器，是中西方文化交流的产物。

sentences.english: Third, valuing cultural exchanges and enhancing mutual understanding.
sentences.chinese: 第三，重视文化交流，增进相互了解。

sentences.english: The two countries will have more chances to develop cultural exchanges.
sentences.chinese: 这将提供更多的机会，使两国开展文化交流。

sentences.english: The goal of our diplomatic visit is cultural exchange.
sentences.chinese: 我们这次奉使出国的目的是文化交流。

sentences.english: Frequent cultural exchange will certainly help foster friendly relations between our two countries.
sentences.chinese: 频繁的文化交流必定会促进我们两国间的友好关系。

sentences.english: In this way they put up a bridge of understanding and communication for cultural exchanges.
sentences.chinese: 文化交流就是这样搭起了一架沟通和理解的桥梁。

sentences.english: The culture communication is bi directional.
Theinvention of movable-type printing greatly promoted the cultural exchanges among countriesall over the world.
sentences.chinese: 活字印刷术的发明大大促进了世界各国的文化交流。

sentences.english: We will vigorously develop cultural exchanges with foreign countries, and make Chinese culture more influential internationally.
sentences.chinese: 积极开展对外文化交流，增强中华文化国际影响力。

definition: the Silk Road/abbr. for 絲綢之路|丝绸之路[Si1 chou2 zhi1 Lu4]
Belt and Road Initiative, Chinese government plan to provide finance and engineering expertise to build infrastructure across Eurasia and northeast Africa, unveiled in 2013
